18#define ZX_HAVE_CONFIG
19
20// Thread local or static memory may be used to reduce the number of (re-)allocations of temporary variables
21// in e.g. the ReedSolomonDecoder. It is disabled by default. It can be enabled by modifying the following define.
22// Note: The Apple clang compiler until XCode 8 does not support c++11's thread_local.
23// The alternative 'static' makes the code thread unsafe.
24#define ZX_THREAD_LOCAL // 'thread_local' or 'static'
25
26// The two basic data structures for storing bits (BitArray and BitMatrix) can be operated by storing one bit
27// of information either in one bit or one byte. Storing it in one byte is considerably faster, while obviously
28// using more memory. The effect of the memory usage while running the TestRunner is virtually invisible.
29// On embedded/mobile systems this might be of importance. Note: the BitMatrix in 'fast' mode still requires
30// only 1/3 of the same image in RGB.
31#define ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE // undef to disable
32
33// There is a faster and simpler approach to how the ODRowReaders work available. This is currently a WIP and
34// disabled by default. This would ultimately lead to a substantial performance improvement, once every RowReader
35// has been ported. E.g. the new Codabar implementation, that actually decodes one row of the image, is about
36// 10x faster than the original one.
37//#define ZX_USE_NEW_ROW_READERS
38
